item.name: Hat of the Harpy
entries: This masterfully crafted silk hat has a large purple feather on its side.

entries.name: Distracting Melody
entries: While you wear the hat, when a creature targets you directly with an attack or a harmful spell, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make a wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC (a creature needn't make the save when it includes you in an area effect, such as the explosion of a {@spell fireball} spell). On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or forfeit targeting someone instead of you, potentially wasting the attack or spell. A creature is immune to this effect, if it is immune to the {@condition charmed} condition or can't hear you. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all expended uses daily at dawn.

entries.name: Luring Song
entries: While you wear the hat, you can sing a magical melody. One humanoid and giant of your choice within 60 feet of you that can hear the song must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. You must take a bonus action on your subsequent turns to continue singing. You can stop singing at any time. The song ends if you are {@condition incapacitated}. While {@condition charmed} this way, a target is {@condition incapacitated}. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from you, the target must move on its turn toward you by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than you, the target can repeat the saving throw. A {@condition charmed} target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until the dawn of the next day.

item.name: Instrument of the Bards, Blileth Hurdy Gurdy
entries: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kind, superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exist, each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} psychic damage.

You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spell, it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.

You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be {@condition charmed} on a failed saving throw, thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.
All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: {@spell fly}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell levitate}, and {@spell protection from evil and good}.
In addition, the Blileth hurdy gurdy can be used to cast {@spell crown of stars|XGE}, {@spell glibness}, and {@spell modify memory}.

item.name: Ikarian Portal Mirror
entries: An ikarian portal mirror is a large object consisting of several floating silver shards and was used by the ikarians for quick transportation and communication.

Each Mirror has a designated location connected to it. While attuned to the mirror and within 30 feet of it, you can transform the mirror into a portal to its connected location for 10 minutes or until you use an action to close it.

Furthermore, as an action while within 10 feet of the mirror, you can name one person. If the person is on the same plane of existance as you, they appear in the mirror and you can talk to them as if they were standing next to you.
Once every seven days, you can cast {@spell gate} opening the portal in the mirror. However, you can not draw creatures through the portal.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragons choice that is within 120 feet and aware of her must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragons Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.
